summary: Drugs that treat certain tropical diseases, rare pediatric diseases and illnesses related to public health emergencies are essential—but they may not be the most profitable to make. When drug developers make these kinds of drugs, FDA can award them “priority review vouchers.” Drug developers can redeem a voucher to speed up FDA review of a future—potentially more profitable—drug. Vouchers can also be sold to other...
title: Drug Development: FDA's Priority Review Voucher Programs
